author: Staff Reporter
text:
Railway Protection Force (RPF) policemen restored a handbag that was left behind on a suburban train by a woman commuter at Guindy station on Sunday. The bag contained cash, jewels and a mobile phone among other valuables.

RPF officials said Tejasri had arrived at Chennai Central on an overnight long distance train from Andhra Pradesh. She boarded the suburban train at Chennai Park and got down at Guindy station.

After alighting at the station and after the train left for St. Thomas Mount, Ms. Tejasri realised that she had left behind her handbag on the train, while she picked up other luggages. She immediately alerted a RPF staff on duty at Guindy station and he informed his colleagues at St. Thomas Mount Railway station.

RPF men managed to retrieve the handbag at Pallavaram railway station and after confirming that the handbag belonged to Ms. Tejasri, handed it over to her. The handbag contained gold jewels, mobile phone, music player and cash worth Rs. one lakh, they added.

Man hit by train

An unidentified man died after being hit by a speeding electric train on Sunday.

The man’s body was found lying near the Chetpet railway station at noon after he was hit by a train bound for Chennai Beach from Tambaram.

Railway policemen said they had sent details about the victim’s identity to other police stations to try and establish his identity. His body has been sent to the mortuary at the Rajiv Gandhi Government General Hospital.

The bag contained gold jewels, mobile phone, music player and cash worth Rs. one lakh
title: Quick action by RPF helps passenger get back handbag
